file_content.text: We've set the Imperial Quesh Venom project back months. I love it when everything works according to plan.
Agent Meldo's taken Doctor Orlian to one of our safe houses. The mission achieved one hundred percent objective completion, thanks to you.
On behalf of the SIS, I officially offer my gratitude and appreciation for a job well done.
It's nice to know there's someone we can turn to when an op goes off the rails.
I received Agent Meldo's report. You have to get Doctor Orlian out of there.
My mission's on hold until I find out what happened to my contact.
A Jedi. Excellent. I'm Senior Field Agent Suria with the SIS.
Ah. The famed captain of Havoc Squad. I'm Senior Field Agent Suria with the SIS.
Captain. I'm Senior Field Agent Suria. I understand you've done extensive work with the SIS.
I'm Senior Field Agent Suria. I understand you've done extensive work with the SIS.
An operation I'm overseeing has run into complications. Fortunately, requesting assistance from you falls within mission protocols.
What do the mission protocols have to do with asking me for help?
What do you mean by that?
I can't ask someone for help if they don't meet proper security briefing clearance levels. Fortunately, you do.
Tell me what you need.
The SIS can't do anything.
Our success ratio is exemplary. But you only hear about the missions that go wrong. Otherwise, it stays in-house.
My current assignment is focused on Doctor Orlian--a key Imperial scientist from the Quesh venom processing lab. He wants to defect.
Without him, their adrenal production operations will be crippled. Getting him to come over to the Republic is a huge win.
Why is he defecting?
What did you offer him?
How'd you win the doc over?
The usual: asylum, credits, the chance to head a Republic research team.
Can you trust him?
There's a reason we're taking this slow.
Don't start patting yourself on the back too soon. He could change his mind.
He's not here yet.
Unlikely. We didn't just jump into this blind. We did all the appropriate background research.
We have an undercover agent inside the Imperial facility. He's handling all the details of the op. But he missed his last two check-ins.
This is a delicate operation. I need to make contact to find out what's happening.
I'll find him.
What? No--you'll blow his cover! We need to be discreet.
What's your plan?
I want you to knock out the Imperial facility's security stations, then go to this designated rendezvous point.
If Agent Meldo hasn't been compromised, he'll follow mission protocols and meet you there. Get his report and bring it back to me.
I'm busy. [Refuse quest]
Fine. I'll find someone else. Just don't go blabbing this info to everyone you meet.
I can't talk now. I'm busy.
